page.title: 13LOCAL THEATRE
page.content: The centre for{entertainment}for the area is the{Lambeague Hall.}Situated in the village, it provides a venue for{dancing, plays, concerts and {parties.}A recent addition, provided through the use of workers from the Manpower Services Commission, is a games room, with facilities for {billiards and snooker.} A group of local men, women and children, calling themselves{'The {Coverack Singers',}produce a number of concerts each year for the entertainment of residents and visitors alike. The concerts, which are good family entertainment, usually run for three evenings. Throughout the run the Lambeague Hall can be expected to be full to capacity, attended by all members f the families. The front row seats, affording the best view, are usually taken up by the children.
